name: St. René Goupil

locations.description: Jesuit lay brother, one of the North American Martyrs in Canada

summary: René Goupil was a French Jesuit lay brother and martyr who worked as a missionary in New France (Canada). He was a surgeon who joined the Jesuits as a donné (lay assistant). He was captured by Iroquois warriors along with Isaac Jogues, tortured, and killed. He is one of the North American Martyrs (also known as the Canadian Martyrs) and is the first of the group to be martyred. He is remembered for his medical skills and his dedication to the mission.
